Key Arguments: The legislation has the potential for extreme abuse and is a tool for government control over information.
It reflects a lack of respect and trust from the government towards Australians.
Existing codes of conduct on social media platforms are biased and do not determine truth objectively.
The legislation will increase bureaucracy and waste taxpayer money.
It will have negative economic impacts, discouraging business and innovation in Australia.
The legislation will be ineffective in combating misinformation and disinformation.
Free speech is absolute and should not be compromised by government intervention.
Main Themes: Distrust in social media platforms' integrity
Notable Quotes: Make no mistake: I am in full opposition to this proposed law.
This is the stuff of dictatorships.
Free speech is absolute. There is no 'achieving a balance'.
The Government exists to serve the people, not the other way around.
